thread.title: ‘UEFAlona’: The calls that outraged in Barca epic
thread.title_full: ‘UEFAlona’: The calls that outraged in Barca epic

title: ‘UEFAlona’: The calls that outraged in Barca epic
text:
The controversial calls and missed chances that PSG will rue v Barca March 9, 2017 2:20pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS IT’S hard to take much away from Barcelona’s incredible comeback win over PSG, but the French champions’ coach found a way. 
While Unai Emery said his team were impacted by the electric atmosphere at the Nou Camp in the first half, he questioned crucial decisions - including two Barca penalties in the second-half - from German referee Deniz Aytekin that shaped the 6-1 drubbing. 
However, when you’re playing at the Nou Camp in front of 100,000 screaming fans and up against MSN, you don’t want to give the referee any reason to penalise you. 
The first penalty PSG gave away was for a sliding challenge on Neymar, while the second was for an outstretched arm on Luis Suarez. 
Both have been heavily debated in the postscript. 
But that didn’t make the decisions any less painful for Emery. Anyone said uefalona yet? — Ed Malyon (@eaamalyon) March 8, 2017 The diving/gamesmanship also shameful etc etc. But, if you're fighting for the impossible, you have to push everything... — Miguel Delaney (@MiguelDelaney) March 9, 2017 
“The truth is we have let a huge opportunity get away and we are aware of that. In the first-half it was more our fault than them playing well,” he said. 
“In the second-half it changed. The penalty (first penalty converted by Lionel Messi for 3-0) got them off to a great start, but I was already calmer because I could see the team was responding better, were better positioned on the pitch and could do damage. Paris Saint-Germain's Spanish headcoach Unai Emery (L). Source: AFP 
“We had chances to make it 3-2 and then the refereeing decisions, I don’t know if they were right or not, but for sure they damaged us. Then in the last two minutes we lost everything we had recovered in the second-half.” 
PSG’s Qatari president Nasser Al-Khelaifi said: “It’s a nightmare for everyone. Three goals in seven minutes is very difficult. Everybody is upset but now is not the time to talk about it.” 
French sports daily newspaper L’Equipe was in no doubt about the implications of the defeat. 
“Inqualifiable” (”Unspeakable”) was its front page headline for Thursday with its reporter claiming the entire “PSG project” was threatened by the “humiliation”. 
THE CONTROVERSIES and NEAR MISSES THAT WILL HAUNT PSG La une de «L'Equipe» après l'incroyable exploit du Barça face au PSG https://t.co/O06KebXJSh pic.twitter.com/T5hlumooc9 — L'ÉQUIPE (@lequipe) March 9, 2017 
10TH MINUTE: Mascherano handball? 
Barcelona dominated the opening stages but PSG’s Julian Draxler broke into their box and attempted to play a cross to a teammate in the centre. 
The ball struck the outstretched arm of a sliding Javier Mascherano, but the referee turned down PSG’s penalty appeals. PSG with a big shout for a Mascherano handball from Draxler's cross #UCL LIVE: https://t.co/PD1niIs7TI pic.twitter.com/Rgq3m05Z5U — FOX SPORTS Football (@FOXFootballLive) March 8, 2017 
48TH MINUTE: Neymar wins penalty 
Barcelona had taken a 2-0 lead into half-time through Luis Suarez and a Layvin Kurzawa own goal, but minutes into the second half, Barca had a penalty. All Thursday's UCL goals 3:20 
Andres Iniesta lifted a pass in behind the PSG defence. Defender Thomas Meunier tracked back to retrieve it but lost his balance and went to ground before Neymar tripped over him. 
Originally the referee didn’t give a penalty, but then changed his decision after consulting the his official behind the goal-line. 
He pointed to the spot and Lionel Messi made no mistake. Meunier goes to ground. Source: FOX SPORTS Neymar wins a penalty for Barca. Source: FOX SPORTS PSG players complain to the referee. Source: AFP 
52ND MINUTE: Cavani hits the woodwork 
Edinson Cavani did strike 10 minutes after this miss, but it was another moment that could have changed the game. 
The stadium was still heaving after Messi’s penalty when Cavani slid into meet Meunier’s low cross, but saw his effort crash off the post with Marc-Andre Ter Stegen beaten. Edinson Cavani of PSG reacts as his shot hits the post.   
8 5TH MINUTE: Di Maria’s miss 
It was 5-3 and PSG were still set for victory. 
That win certainly would’ve been assured if Angel Di Maria hadn’t missed the target when he ran in behind Barca’s defence to receive the ball, and was one-on-one with Ter Stegen. 
However, under pressure from Mascherano, Di Maria shanked his shot out for a goal kick. 
On first sight, it seemed as though the Barca defender may have caught the Argentine’s heel, but no penalty was given. Di Maria misses a chance on goal. Source: FOX SPORTS Di Maria after a missed chance. Source: FOX SPORTS 
90TH MINUTE: Suarez wins penalty 
As the match entered stoppage time with the score at 3-2, Barca were awarded a second controversial penalty by the referee when Luis Suarez tumbled under a challenge from Marquinhos. 
There was minimal contact, but the striker went to ground and won the spot kick. 
Neymar sent goalkeeper Kevin Trapp the wrong way before he went on to assist Sergi Roberto for the 95th-minute matchwinner. Luis Suarez watches the ball. Source: FOX SPORTS Suarez goes to ground. Source: FOX SPORTS La presse espagnole et «l'impossible» exploit des Barcelonais https://t.co/rUNdmxQKVZ pic.twitter.com/jqxjh21Xih
